availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Robert M. Ekings (Burlington County, New Jersey, machinist and soldier.)

body.p: Burlington County, New Jersey, machinist and soldier. Native of Scotland. Son of John Eckings and Elizabeth Eckings. Machinist in Burlington County, New Jersey, in 1860. Served in the 23rd New Jersey Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a first lieutenant from September 13, 1862 to June 27, 1863. Served in the 34th New Jersey Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a captain and major from September 21, 1863 through December 31, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, New Jersey, Burlington County, Northampton, p. 528.
Record of Officers and Men of New Jersey in the Civil War, vol I, 1861-1865 (Trenton, NJ: John L. Murphy, 1876), 794.
Record of Officers and Men of New Jersey in the Civil War, vol II, 1861-1865 (Trenton, NJ: John L. Murphy, 1876), 1004.
"Robert Mitchell Ekings (1839-1896)," Find A Grave, Memorial #9484949, accessed August 5, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/9484949.
